00078 static int mdd_connect_to_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *m,
00079                                const char *nextdev)
00080 {
00081         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00082         struct lu_device        *lud = mdd2lu_dev(m);
00083         struct obd_device       *obd;
00084         int                      rc;
00085         ENTRY;
00086 
00087         LASSERT(m->mdd_child_exp == NULL);
00088 
00089         OBD_ALLOC(data, sizeof(*data));
00090         if (data == NULL)
00091                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00092 
00093         obd = class_name2obd(nextdev);
00094         if (obd == NULL) {
00095                 CERROR("can't locate next device: %s\n", nextdev);
00096                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
00097         }
00098 
00099         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
00100         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00101 
00102         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &m->mdd_child_exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data, NULL);
00103         if (rc) {
00104                 CERROR("cannot connect to next dev %s (%d)\n", nextdev, rc);
00105                 GOTO(out, rc);
00106         }
00107 
00108         lud->ld_site = m->mdd_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
00109         LASSERT(lud->ld_site);
00110         m->mdd_child = lu2dt_dev(m->mdd_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00111         m->mdd_bottom = lu2dt_dev(lud->ld_site->ls_bottom_dev);
00112         lu_dev_add_linkage(lud->ld_site, lud);
00113 
00114 out:
00115         if (data)
00116                 OBD_FREE(data, sizeof(*data));
00117         RETURN(rc);
00118 }
00119 
00120 static int mdd_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd,
00121                 struct lu_device_type *t, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00122 {
00123         int rc = -EINVAL;
00124         const char *dev;
00125         ENTRY;
00126 
00127         dev = lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 0);
00128         if (dev == NULL)
00129                 RETURN(rc);
00130 
00131         mdd->mdd_md_dev.md_lu_dev.ld_obd = class_name2obd(dev);
00132         if (mdd->mdd_md_dev.md_lu_dev.ld_obd == NULL)
00133                 RETURN(rc);
00134         mdd->mdd_md_dev.md_lu_dev.ld_ops = &mdd_lu_ops;
00135         mdd->mdd_md_dev.md_ops = &mdd_ops;
00136 
00137         rc = mdd_connect_to_next(env, mdd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 3));
00138         if (rc != 0)
00139                 RETURN(rc);
00140 
00141         mdd->mdd_atime_diff = MAX_ATIME_DIFF;
00142         /* sync permission changes */
00143         mdd->mdd_sync_permission = 1;
00144 
00145         dt_conf_get(env, mdd->mdd_child, &mdd->mdd_dt_conf);
00146 
00147         /* we are using service name but not mdd obd name
00148          * for compatibility reasons.
00149          * It is passed from MDT in lustre_cfg[2] buffer */
00150         rc = mdd_procfs_init(mdd, lustre_cfg_string(lcfg, 2));
00151         if (rc < 0)
00152                 obd_disconnect(mdd->mdd_child_exp);
00153 
00154         RETURN(rc);
00155 }

00157 static struct lu_device *mdd_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00158                                          struct lu_device *d)
00159 {
00160         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(d);
00161 
00162         if (d->ld_site)
00163                 lu_dev_del_linkage(d->ld_site, d);
00164 
00165         mdd_procfs_fini(mdd);
00166         return NULL;
00167 }
00168 
00169 static int changelog_init_cb(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *llh,
00170                              struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr, void *data)
00171 {
00172         struct mdd_device *mdd = (struct mdd_device *)data;
00173         struct llog_changelog_rec *rec = (struct llog_changelog_rec *)hdr;
00174 
00175         LASSERT(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN);
00176         LASSERT(rec->cr_hdr.lrh_type == CHANGELOG_REC);
00177 
00178         CDEBUG(D_INFO,
00179                "seeing record at index %d/%d/"LPU64" t=%x %.*s in log"
00180                DOSTID"\n", hdr->lrh_index, rec->cr_hdr.lrh_index,
00181                rec->cr.cr_index, rec->cr.cr_type, rec->cr.cr_namelen,
00182                changelog_rec_name(&rec->cr), POSTID(&llh->lgh_id.lgl_oi));
00183 
00184         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index = rec->cr.cr_index;
00185         return LLOG_PROC_BREAK;
00186 }
00187 
00188 static int changelog_user_init_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
00189                                   struct llog_handle *llh,
00190                                   struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr, void *data)
00191 {
00192         struct mdd_device *mdd = (struct mdd_device *)data;
00193         struct llog_changelog_user_rec *rec =
00194                 (struct llog_changelog_user_rec *)hdr;
00195 
00196         LASSERT(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN);
00197         LASSERT(rec->cur_hdr.lrh_type == CHANGELOG_USER_REC);
00198 
00199         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "seeing user at index %d/%d id=%d endrec="LPU64
00200                " in log "DOSTID"\n", hdr->lrh_index, rec->cur_hdr.lrh_index,
00201                rec->cur_id, rec->cur_endrec, POSTID(&llh->lgh_id.lgl_oi));
00202 
00203         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
00204         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lastuser = rec->cur_id;
00205         if (rec->cur_endrec > mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index)
00206                 mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index = rec->cur_endrec;
00207         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
00208 
00209         return LLOG_PROC_BREAK;
00210 }
00211 
00212 static int llog_changelog_cancel_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
00213                                     struct llog_handle *llh,
00214                                     struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr, void *data)
00215 {
00216         struct llog_changelog_rec *rec = (struct llog_changelog_rec *)hdr;
00217         struct llog_cookie       cookie;
00218         long long                endrec = *(long long *)data;
00219         int                      rc;
00220 
00221         ENTRY;
00222 
00223         /* This is always a (sub)log, not the catalog */
00224         LASSERT(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN);
00225 
00226         if (rec->cr.cr_index > endrec)
00227                 /* records are in order, so we're done */
00228                 RETURN(LLOG_PROC_BREAK);
00229 
00230         cookie.lgc_lgl = llh->lgh_id;
00231         cookie.lgc_index = hdr->lrh_index;
00232 
00233         /* cancel them one at a time.  I suppose we could store up the cookies
00234          * and cancel them all at once; probably more efficient, but this is
00235          * done as a user call, so who cares... */
00236         rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, llh->u.phd.phd_cat_handle, 1,
00237                                      &cookie);
00238         RETURN(rc < 0 ? rc : 0);
00239 }
00240 
00241 static int llog_changelog_cancel(const struct lu_env *env,
00242                                  struct llog_ctxt *ctxt,
00243                                  struct llog_cookie *cookies, int flags)
00244 {
00245         struct llog_handle      *cathandle = ctxt->loc_handle;
00246         int                      rc;
00247 
00248         ENTRY;
00249 
00250         /* This should only be called with the catalog handle */
00251         LASSERT(cathandle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT);
00252 
00253         rc = llog_cat_process(env, cathandle, llog_changelog_cancel_cb,
00254                               (void *)cookies, 0, 0);
00255         if (rc >= 0)
00256                 /* 0 or 1 means we're done */
00257                 rc = 0;
00258         else
00259                 CERROR("%s: cancel idx %u of catalog "DOSTID" rc=%d\n",
00260                        ctxt->loc_obd->obd_name, cathandle->lgh_last_idx,
00261                        POSTID(&cathandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi), rc);
00262 
00263         RETURN(rc);
00264 }
00265 
00266 static struct llog_operations changelog_orig_logops;
00267 
00268 static int
00269 mdd_changelog_write_header(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd,
00270                            int markerflags);
00271 
00272 static int
00273 mdd_changelog_on(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd)
00274 {
00275         int rc = 0;
00276 
00277         if ((mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags & CLM_ON) != 0)
00278                 return rc;
00279 
00280         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: changelog on\n", mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name);
00281         if (mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags & CLM_ERR) {
00282                 CERROR("Changelogs cannot be enabled due to error "
00283                        "condition (see %s log).\n",
00284                        mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name);
00285                 rc = -ESRCH;
00286         } else {
00287                 spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00288                 mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags |= CLM_ON;
00289                 spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00290                 rc = mdd_changelog_write_header(env, mdd, CLM_START);
00291         }
00292         return rc;
00293 }
00294 
00295 static int
00296 mdd_changelog_off(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd)
00297 {
00298         int rc = 0;
00299 
00300         if ((mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags & CLM_ON) != CLM_ON)
00301                 return rc;
00302 
00303         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: changelog off\n", mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name);
00304         rc = mdd_changelog_write_header(env, mdd, CLM_FINI);
00305         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00306         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags &= ~CLM_ON;
00307         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00308 
00309         return rc;
00310 }
00311 
00312 static int mdd_changelog_llog_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00313                                    struct mdd_device *mdd)
00314 {
00315         struct obd_device       *obd = mdd2obd_dev(mdd);
00316         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt = NULL, *uctxt = NULL;
00317         int                      rc;
00318 
00319         ENTRY;
00320 
00321         /* LU-2844 mdd setup failure should not cause umount oops */
00322         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_CHANGELOG_INIT))
00323                 RETURN(-EIO);
00324 
00325         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(&obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
00326         obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = mdd->mdd_bottom;
00327         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT,
00328                         obd, &changelog_orig_logops);
00329         if (rc) {
00330                 CERROR("%s: changelog llog setup failed: rc = %d\n",
00331                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00332                 RETURN(rc);
00333         }
00334 
00335         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
00336         LASSERT(ctxt);
00337 
00338         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &ctxt->loc_handle, NULL,
00339                               CHANGELOG_CATALOG);
00340         if (rc)
00341                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00342 
00343         rc = llog_init_handle(env, ctxt->loc_handle, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, NULL);
00344         if (rc)
00345                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00346 
00347         rc = llog_cat_reverse_process(env, ctxt->loc_handle,
00348                                       changelog_init_cb, mdd);
00349 
00350         if (rc < 0) {
00351                 CERROR("%s: changelog init failed: rc = %d\n", obd->obd_name,
00352                        rc);
00353                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00354         }
00355 
00356         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "changelog starting index="LPU64"\n",
00357                mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index);
00358 
00359         /* setup user changelog */
00360         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_CHANGELOG_USER_ORIG_CTXT,
00361                         obd, &changelog_orig_logops);
00362         if (rc) {
00363                 CERROR("%s: changelog users llog setup failed: rc = %d\n",
00364                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00365                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00366         }
00367 
00368         uctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_USER_ORIG_CTXT);
00369         LASSERT(ctxt);
00370 
00371         rc = llog_open_create(env, uctxt, &uctxt->loc_handle, NULL,
00372                               CHANGELOG_USERS);
00373         if (rc)
00374                 GOTO(out_ucleanup, rc);
00375 
00376         uctxt->loc_handle->lgh_logops->lop_add = llog_cat_add_rec;
00377         uctxt->loc_handle->lgh_logops->lop_declare_add = llog_cat_declare_add_rec;
00378 
00379         rc = llog_init_handle(env, uctxt->loc_handle, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, NULL);
00380         if (rc)
00381                 GOTO(out_uclose, rc);
00382 
00383         rc = llog_cat_reverse_process(env, uctxt->loc_handle,
00384                                       changelog_user_init_cb, mdd);
00385         if (rc < 0) {
00386                 CERROR("%s: changelog user init failed: rc = %d\n",
00387                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00388                 GOTO(out_uclose, rc);
00389         }
00390 
00391         /* If we have registered users, assume we want changelogs on */
00392         if (mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lastuser > 0) {
00393                 rc = mdd_changelog_on(env, mdd);
00394                 if (rc < 0)
00395                         GOTO(out_uclose, rc);
00396         }
00397         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00398         llog_ctxt_put(uctxt);
00399         RETURN(0);
00400 out_uclose:
00401         llog_cat_close(env, uctxt->loc_handle);
00402 out_ucleanup:
00403         llog_cleanup(env, uctxt);
00404 out_close:
00405         llog_cat_close(env, ctxt->loc_handle);
00406 out_cleanup:
00407         llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00408         return rc;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static int mdd_changelog_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd)
00412 {
00413         struct obd_device       *obd = mdd2obd_dev(mdd);
00414         int                      rc;
00415 
00416         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index = 0;
00417         spin_lock_init(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00418         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_starttime = cfs_time_current_64();
00419         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags = 0; /* off by default */
00420         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_mask = CHANGELOG_DEFMASK;
00421         spin_lock_init(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
00422         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lastuser = 0;
00423 
00424         rc = mdd_changelog_llog_init(env, mdd);
00425         if (rc) {
00426                 CERROR("%s: changelog setup during init failed: rc = %d\n",
00427                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00428                 mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags |= CLM_ERR;
00429         }
00430 
00431         return rc;
00432 }
00433 
00434 static void mdd_changelog_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00435                                struct mdd_device *mdd)
00436 {
00437         struct obd_device       *obd = mdd2obd_dev(mdd);
00438         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
00439 
00440         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags = 0;
00441 
00442         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
00443         if (ctxt) {
00444                 llog_cat_close(env, ctxt->loc_handle);
00445                 llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00446         }
00447         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_USER_ORIG_CTXT);
00448         if (ctxt) {
00449                 llog_cat_close(env, ctxt->loc_handle);
00450                 llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00451         }
00452 }
00453 
00460 static int
00461 mdd_changelog_llog_cancel(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd,
00462                           long long endrec)
00463 {
00464         struct obd_device *obd = mdd2obd_dev(mdd);
00465         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
00466         long long unsigned cur;
00467         int rc;
00468 
00469         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
00470         if (ctxt == NULL)
00471                 return -ENXIO;
00472 
00473         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00474         cur = (long long)mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index;
00475         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00476         if (endrec > cur)
00477                 endrec = cur;
00478 
00479         /* purge to "0" is shorthand for everything */
00480         if (endrec == 0)
00481                 endrec = cur;
00482 
00483         /* If purging all records, write a header entry so we don't have an
00484            empty catalog and we're sure to have a valid starting index next
00485            time.  In case of crash, we just restart with old log so we're
00486            allright. */
00487         if (endrec == cur) {
00488                 /* XXX: transaction is started by llog itself */
00489                 rc = mdd_changelog_write_header(env, mdd, CLM_PURGE);
00490                 if (rc)
00491                       goto out;
00492         }
00493 
00494         /* Some records were purged, so reset repeat-access time (so we
00495            record new mtime update records, so users can see a file has been
00496            changed since the last purge) */
00497         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_starttime = cfs_time_current_64();
00498 
00499         rc = llog_cancel(env, ctxt, (struct llog_cookie *)&endrec, 0);
00500 out:
00501         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00502         return rc;
00503 }
00504 
00510 int mdd_changelog_write_header(const struct lu_env *env,
00511                                struct mdd_device *mdd, int markerflags)
00512 {
00513         struct obd_device               *obd = mdd2obd_dev(mdd);
00514         struct llog_changelog_rec       *rec;
00515         struct lu_buf                   *buf;
00516         struct llog_ctxt                *ctxt;
00517         int                              reclen;
00518         int                              len = strlen(obd->obd_name);
00519         int                              rc;
00520 
00521         ENTRY;
00522 
00523         if (mdd->mdd_cl.mc_mask & (1 << CL_MARK)) {
00524                 mdd->mdd_cl.mc_starttime = cfs_time_current_64();
00525                 RETURN(0);
00526         }
00527 
00528         reclen = llog_data_len(sizeof(*rec) + len);
00529         buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(&mdd_env_info(env)->mti_big_buf, reclen);
00530         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
00531                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00532         rec = buf->lb_buf;
00533 
00534         rec->cr.cr_flags = CLF_VERSION;
00535         rec->cr.cr_type = CL_MARK;
00536         rec->cr.cr_namelen = len;
00537         memcpy(changelog_rec_name(&rec->cr), obd->obd_name, rec->cr.cr_namelen);
00538         /* Status and action flags */
00539         rec->cr.cr_markerflags = mdd->mdd_cl.mc_flags | markerflags;
00540         rec->cr_hdr.lrh_len = llog_data_len(changelog_rec_size(&rec->cr) +
00541                                             rec->cr.cr_namelen);
00542         rec->cr_hdr.lrh_type = CHANGELOG_REC;
00543         rec->cr.cr_time = cl_time();
00544         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00545         rec->cr.cr_index = ++mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index;
00546         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
00547 
00548         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
00549         LASSERT(ctxt);
00550 
00551         rc = llog_cat_add(env, ctxt->loc_handle, &rec->cr_hdr, NULL);
00552         if (rc > 0)
00553                 rc = 0;
00554         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00555 
00556         /* assume on or off event; reset repeat-access time */
00557         mdd->mdd_cl.mc_starttime = cfs_time_current_64();
00558         RETURN(rc);
00559 }
00560 
00565 static int obf_lookup(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_object *p,
00566                       const struct lu_name *lname, struct lu_fid *f,
00567                       struct md_op_spec *spec)
00568 {
00569         char *name = (char *)lname->ln_name;
00570         struct mdd_device *mdd = mdo2mdd(p);
00571         struct mdd_object *child;
00572         int rc = 0;
00573 
00574         while (*name == '[')
00575                 name++;
00576 
00577         sscanf(name, SFID, RFID(f));
00578         if (!fid_is_sane(f)) {
00579                 CWARN("%s: Trying to lookup invalid FID [%s] in %s/%s, FID "
00580                       "format should be "DFID"\n", mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name,
00581                       lname->ln_name, dot_lustre_name, mdd_obf_dir_name,
00582                       (__u64)FID_SEQ_NORMAL, 1, 0);
00583                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00584         }
00585 
00586         if (!fid_is_norm(f) && !fid_is_igif(f) && !fid_is_root(f) &&
00587             !fid_seq_is_dot(f->f_seq)) {
00588                 CWARN("%s: Trying to lookup invalid FID "DFID" in %s/%s, "
00589                       "sequence should be >= "LPX64" or within ["LPX64","
00590                       ""LPX64"].\n", mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name, PFID(f),
00591                       dot_lustre_name, mdd_obf_dir_name, (__u64)FID_SEQ_NORMAL,
00592                       (__u64)FID_SEQ_IGIF, (__u64)FID_SEQ_IGIF_MAX);
00593                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00594         }
00595 
00596         /* Check if object with this fid exists */
00597         child = mdd_object_find(env, mdd, f);
00598         if (IS_ERR(child))
00599                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(child));
00600 
00601         if (mdd_object_exists(child) == 0)
00602                 rc = -ENOENT;
00603 
00604         mdd_object_put(env, child);
00605 
00606 out:
00607         return rc;
00608 }
00609

00659 static struct md_dir_operations mdd_lpf_dir_ops = {
00660         .mdo_lookup = mdd_lookup,
00661         .mdo_create = mdd_dummy_create,
00662         .mdo_rename = mdd_dummy_rename,
00663         .mdo_link   = mdd_dummy_link,

00666 
00667 static struct md_object *mdo_locate(const struct lu_env *env,
00668                                     struct md_device *md,
00669                                     const struct lu_fid *fid)
00670 {
00671         struct lu_object *obj;
00672         struct md_object *mdo;
00673 
00674         obj = lu_object_find(env, &md->md_lu_dev, fid, NULL);
00675         if (!IS_ERR(obj)) {
00676                 obj = lu_object_locate(obj->lo_header, md->md_lu_dev.ld_type);
00677                 LASSERT(obj != NULL);
00678                 mdo = lu2md(obj);
00679         } else {
00680                 mdo = ERR_PTR(PTR_ERR(obj));
00681         }
00682         return mdo;
00683 }
00684 
00685 static int mdd_lpf_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *m)
00686 {
00687         struct md_object        *mdo;
00688         struct mdd_object       *mdd_lpf;
00689         struct lu_fid            fid    = LU_LPF_FID;
00690         int                      rc;
00691         ENTRY;
00692 
00693         rc = mdd_local_file_create(env, m, mdd_object_fid(m->mdd_dot_lustre),
00694                                    mdd_lpf_dir_name, S_IFDIR | S_IRUSR | S_IXUSR,
00695                                    &fid);
00696         if (rc != 0)
00697                 RETURN(rc);
00698 
00699         mdo = mdo_locate(env, &m->mdd_md_dev, &fid);
00700         if (IS_ERR(mdo))
00701                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(mdo));
00702 
00703         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(&mdo->mo_lu));
00704 
00705         mdd_lpf = md2mdd_obj(mdo);
00706         mdd_lpf->mod_obj.mo_dir_ops = &mdd_lpf_dir_ops;
00707         m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_lpf = mdd_lpf;
00708 
00709         RETURN(0);
00710 }
00711 
00715 static int mdd_obf_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *m)
00716 {
00717         struct md_object        *mdo;
00718         struct mdd_object       *mdd_obf;
00719         struct lu_fid            fid = LU_OBF_FID;
00720         int                      rc;
00721 
00722         rc = mdd_local_file_create(env, m, mdd_object_fid(m->mdd_dot_lustre),
00723                                    mdd_obf_dir_name, S_IFDIR | S_IXUSR, &fid);
00724         if (rc < 0)
00725                 RETURN(rc);
00726 
00727         mdo = mdo_locate(env, &m->mdd_md_dev, &fid);
00728         if (IS_ERR(mdo))
00729                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(mdo));
00730 
00731         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(&mdo->mo_lu));
00732 
00733         mdd_obf = md2mdd_obj(mdo);
00734         mdd_obf->mod_obj.mo_dir_ops = &mdd_obf_dir_ops;
00735         m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_obf = mdd_obf;
00736 
00737         return 0;
00738 }
00739 
00740 static void mdd_dot_lustre_cleanup(const struct lu_env *env,
00741                                    struct mdd_device *m)
00742 {
00743         if (m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_lpf != NULL) {
00744                 mdd_object_put(env, m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_lpf);
00745                 m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_lpf = NULL;
00746         }
00747         if (m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_obf != NULL) {
00748                 mdd_object_put(env, m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_obf);
00749                 m->mdd_dot_lustre_objs.mdd_obf = NULL;
00750         }
00751         if (m->mdd_dot_lustre != NULL) {
00752                 mdd_object_put(env, m->mdd_dot_lustre);
00753                 m->mdd_dot_lustre = NULL;
00754         }
00755 }
00756 
00758 static int mdd_dot_lustre_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *m)
00759 {
00760         struct md_object        *mdo;
00761         struct lu_fid            fid;
00762         int                      rc;
00763 
00764         ENTRY;
00765         /* Create ".lustre" directory in ROOT. */
00766         fid = LU_DOT_LUSTRE_FID;
00767         rc = mdd_local_file_create(env, m, &m->mdd_root_fid,
00768                                    dot_lustre_name,
00769                                    S_IFDIR | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR | S_IXUGO,
00770                                    &fid);
00771         if (rc < 0)
00772                 RETURN(rc);
00773         mdo = mdo_locate(env, &m->mdd_md_dev, &fid);
00774         if (IS_ERR(mdo))
00775                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(mdo));
00776         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(&mdo->mo_lu));
00777 
00778         m->mdd_dot_lustre = md2mdd_obj(mdo);
00779 
00780         rc = mdd_obf_setup(env, m);
00781         if (rc) {
00782                 CERROR("%s: error initializing \"fid\" object: rc = %d.\n",
00783                        mdd2obd_dev(m)->obd_name, rc);
00784                 GOTO(out, rc);
00785         }
00786 
00787         rc = mdd_lpf_setup(env, m);
00788         if (rc != 0) {
00789                 CERROR("%s: error initializing \"lost+found\": rc = %d.\n",
00790                        mdd2obd_dev(m)->obd_name, rc);
00791                 GOTO(out, rc);
00792         }
00793 
00794         RETURN(0);
00795 
00796 out:
00797         mdd_dot_lustre_cleanup(env, m);
00798 
00799         return rc;
00800 }
00801 
00802 
00803 static struct llog_operations hsm_actions_logops;
00804 
00809 static int mdd_hsm_actions_llog_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00810                                      struct mdd_device *m)
00811 {
00812         struct obd_device       *obd = mdd2obd_dev(m);
00813         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt = NULL;
00814         int                      rc;
00815         ENTRY;
00816 
00817         OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(&obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt);
00818         obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt = m->mdd_bottom;
00819 
00820         rc = llog_setup(env, obd, &obd->obd_olg, LLOG_AGENT_ORIG_CTXT,
00821                         obd, &hsm_actions_logops);
00822         if (rc) {
00823                 CERROR("%s: hsm actions llog setup failed: rc = %d\n",
00824                         obd->obd_name, rc);
00825                 RETURN(rc);
00826         }
00827 
00828         ctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_AGENT_ORIG_CTXT);
00829         LASSERT(ctxt);
00830 
00831         rc = llog_open_create(env, ctxt, &ctxt->loc_handle, NULL,
00832                               HSM_ACTIONS);
00833         if (rc) {
00834                 CERROR("%s: hsm actions llog open_create failed: rc = %d\n",
00835                         obd->obd_name, rc);
00836                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00837         }
00838 
00839         rc = llog_init_handle(env, ctxt->loc_handle, LLOG_F_IS_CAT, NULL);
00840         if (rc)
00841                 GOTO(out_close, rc);
00842 
00843         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
00844         RETURN(0);
00845 
00846 out_close:
00847         llog_cat_close(env, ctxt->loc_handle);
00848         ctxt->loc_handle = NULL;
00849 out_cleanup:
00850         llog_cleanup(env, ctxt);
00851 
00852         return rc;
00853 }
00854 
00858 static int mdd_hsm_actions_llog_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00859                                      struct mdd_device *m)
00860 {
00861         struct obd_device       *obd = mdd2obd_dev(m);
00862         struct llog_ctxt        *lctxt;
00863         ENTRY;
00864 
00865         lctxt = llog_get_context(obd, LLOG_AGENT_ORIG_CTXT);
00866         if (lctxt) {
00867                 llog_cat_close(env, lctxt->loc_handle);
00868                 lctxt->loc_handle = NULL;
00869                 llog_cleanup(env, lctxt);
00870         }
00871 
00872         RETURN(0);
00873 }
00874 
00875 static void mdd_device_shutdown(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *m,
00876                                 struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00877 {
00878         mdd_generic_thread_stop(&m->mdd_orph_cleanup_thread);
00879         lfsck_degister(env, m->mdd_bottom);
00880         mdd_hsm_actions_llog_fini(env, m);
00881         mdd_changelog_fini(env, m);
00882         orph_index_fini(env, m);
00883         mdd_dot_lustre_cleanup(env, m);
00884         if (m->mdd_los != NULL) {
00885                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, m->mdd_los);
00886                 m->mdd_los = NULL;
00887         }
00888         lu_site_purge(env, mdd2lu_dev(m)->ld_site, ~0);
00889 
00890         if (m->mdd_child_exp)
00891                 obd_disconnect(m->mdd_child_exp);
00892 }
00893 
00894 static int mdd_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
00895                               struct lu_device *d, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00896 {
00897         struct mdd_device *m    = lu2mdd_dev(d);
00898         struct dt_device  *dt   = m->mdd_child;
00899         struct lu_device  *next = &dt->dd_lu_dev;
00900         int rc;
00901         ENTRY;
00902 
00903         switch (cfg->lcfg_command) {
00904         case LCFG_PARAM: {
00905                 struct obd_device *obd = mdd2obd_dev(m);
00906 
00907                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_MDD, obd->obd_vars, cfg, m);
00908                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS)
00909                         /* we don't understand; pass it on */
00910                         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00911                 break;
00912         }
00913         case LCFG_SETUP:
00914                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00915                 if (rc)
00916                         GOTO(out, rc);
00917                 dt_conf_get(env, dt, &m->mdd_dt_conf);
00918                 break;
00919         case LCFG_CLEANUP:
00920                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00921                 lu_dev_del_linkage(d->ld_site, d);
00922                 mdd_device_shutdown(env, m, cfg);
00923                 break;
00924         default:
00925                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00926                 break;
00927         }
00928 out:
00929         RETURN(rc);
00930 }
00931 
00932 static int mdd_recovery_complete(const struct lu_env *env,
00933                                  struct lu_device *d)
00934 {
00935         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(d);
00936         struct lu_device *next;
00937         int rc;
00938         ENTRY;
00939 
00940         LASSERT(mdd != NULL);
00941         next = &mdd->mdd_child->dd_lu_dev;
00942 
00943         /* XXX: orphans handling. */
00944         mdd_orphan_cleanup(env, mdd);
00945         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_recovery_complete(env, next);
00946 
00947         RETURN(rc);
00948 }
00949 
00950 int mdd_local_file_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdd_device *mdd,
00951                           const struct lu_fid *pfid, const char *name,
00952                           __u32 mode, struct lu_fid *fid)
00953 {
00954         struct dt_object *parent, *dto;
00955         int rc;
00956 
00957         ENTRY;
00958 
00959         LASSERT(!fid_is_zero(pfid));
00960         parent = dt_locate(env, mdd->mdd_bottom, pfid);
00961         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(parent)))
00962                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(parent));
00963 
00964         /* create local file/dir, if @fid is passed then try to use it */
00965         if (fid_is_zero(fid))
00966                 dto = local_file_find_or_create(env, mdd->mdd_los, parent,
00967                                                 name, mode);
00968         else
00969                 dto = local_file_find_or_create_with_fid(env, mdd->mdd_bottom,
00970                                                          fid, parent, name,
00971                                                          mode);
00972         if (IS_ERR(dto))
00973                 GOTO(out_put, rc = PTR_ERR(dto));
00974         *fid = *lu_object_fid(&dto->do_lu);
00975         /* since stack is not fully set up the local_storage uses own stack
00976          * and we should drop its object from cache */
00977         lu_object_put_nocache(env, &dto->do_lu);
00978         EXIT;
00979 out_put:
00980         lu_object_put(env, &parent->do_lu);
00981         return 0;
00982 }
00983 
00984 static int mdd_lfsck_out_notify(const struct lu_env *env, void *data,
00985                                 enum lfsck_events event)
00986 {
00987         return 0;
00988 }
00989 
00990 static int mdd_prepare(const struct lu_env *env,
00991                        struct lu_device *pdev,
00992                        struct lu_device *cdev)
00993 {
00994         struct mdd_device       *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(cdev);
00995         struct lu_device        *next = &mdd->mdd_child->dd_lu_dev;
00996         struct lu_fid            fid;
00997         int                      rc;
00998 
00999         ENTRY;
01000 
01001         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_prepare(env, cdev, next);
01002         if (rc)
01003                 RETURN(rc);
01004 
01005         /* Setup local dirs */
01006         fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_LOCAL_NAME;
01007         fid.f_oid = 1;
01008         fid.f_ver = 0;
01009         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, mdd->mdd_bottom, &fid,
01010                                     &mdd->mdd_los);
01011         if (rc)
01012                 RETURN(rc);
01013 
01014         rc = dt_root_get(env, mdd->mdd_child, &mdd->mdd_local_root_fid);
01015         if (rc < 0)
01016                 GOTO(out_los, rc);
01017 
01018         lu_root_fid(&fid);
01019         if (mdd_seq_site(mdd)->ss_node_id == 0) {
01020                 rc = mdd_local_file_create(env, mdd, &mdd->mdd_local_root_fid,
01021                                            mdd_root_dir_name, S_IFDIR |
01022                                            S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR | S_IXUGO, &fid);
01023                 if (rc != 0) {
01024                         CERROR("%s: create root fid failed: rc = %d\n",
01025                                mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name, rc);
01026                         GOTO(out_los, rc);
01027                 }
01028 
01029                 mdd->mdd_root_fid = fid;
01030                 rc = mdd_dot_lustre_setup(env, mdd);
01031                 if (rc != 0) {
01032                         CERROR("%s: initializing .lustre failed: rc = %d\n",
01033                                mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name, rc);
01034                         GOTO(out_los, rc);
01035                 }
01036         } else {
01037                 /* Normal client usually send root access to MDT0 directly,
01038                  * the root FID on non-MDT0 will only be used by echo client. */
01039                 mdd->mdd_root_fid = fid;
01040         }
01041 
01042         rc = orph_index_init(env, mdd);
01043         if (rc < 0)
01044                 GOTO(out_dot, rc);
01045 
01046         rc = mdd_changelog_init(env, mdd);
01047         if (rc != 0) {
01048                 CERROR("%s: failed to initialize changelog: rc = %d\n",
01049                        mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name, rc);
01050                 GOTO(out_orph, rc);
01051         }
01052 
01053         rc = mdd_hsm_actions_llog_init(env, mdd);
01054         if (rc != 0)
01055                 GOTO(out_changelog, rc);
01056 
01057         rc = lfsck_register(env, mdd->mdd_bottom, mdd->mdd_child,
01058                             mdd2obd_dev(mdd), mdd_lfsck_out_notify,
01059                             mdd, true);
01060         if (rc != 0) {
01061                 CERROR("%s: failed to initialize lfsck: rc = %d\n",
01062                        mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_name, rc);
01063                 GOTO(out_hsm, rc);
01064         }
01065         RETURN(0);
01066 out_hsm:
01067         mdd_hsm_actions_llog_fini(env, mdd);
01068 out_changelog:
01069         mdd_changelog_fini(env, mdd);
01070 out_orph:
01071         orph_index_fini(env, mdd);
01072 out_dot:
01073         if (mdd_seq_site(mdd)->ss_node_id == 0)
01074                 mdd_dot_lustre_cleanup(env, mdd);
01075 out_los:
01076         local_oid_storage_fini(env, mdd->mdd_los);
01077         mdd->mdd_los = NULL;
01078 
01079         return rc;
01080 }
01081 
01082 const struct lu_device_operations mdd_lu_ops = {
01083         .ldo_object_alloc      = mdd_object_alloc,
01084         .ldo_process_config    = mdd_process_config,
01085         .ldo_recovery_complete = mdd_recovery_complete,
01086         .ldo_prepare           = mdd_prepare,
01087 };

01089 static int mdd_root_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01090                         struct md_device *m, struct lu_fid *f)
01091 {
01092         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(&m->md_lu_dev);
01093 
01094         ENTRY;
01095         *f = mdd->mdd_root_fid;
01096         RETURN(0);
01097 }

01099 /*
01100  * No permission check is needed.
01101  */
01102 static int mdd_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_device *m,
01103                       struct obd_statfs *sfs)
01104 {
01105         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(&m->md_lu_dev);
01106         int rc;
01107 
01108         ENTRY;
01109 
01110         rc = mdd_child_ops(mdd)->dt_statfs(env, mdd->mdd_child, sfs);
01111 
01112         sfs->os_namelen = min_t(__u32, sfs->os_namelen, NAME_MAX);
01113 
01114         RETURN(rc);
01115 }

01117 static int mdd_maxeasize_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_device *m,
01118                                 int *easize)
01119 {
01120         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(&m->md_lu_dev);

01122

01124 
01125         RETURN(0);

01127 
01128 static int mdd_llog_ctxt_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_device *m,
01129                              int idx, void **h)
01130 {
01131         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(&m->md_lu_dev);
01132 
01133         *h = llog_group_get_ctxt(&mdd2obd_dev(mdd)->obd_olg, idx);
01134         return (*h == NULL ? -ENOENT : 0);
01135 }
01136 
01137 static struct lu_device *mdd_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
01138                                          struct lu_device *lu)
01139 {
01140         struct mdd_device *m = lu2mdd_dev(lu);
01141         ENTRY;
01142 
01143         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lu->ld_ref) == 0);
01144         md_device_fini(&m->mdd_md_dev);
01145         OBD_FREE_PTR(m);
01146         RETURN(NULL);
01147 }
01148 
01149 static struct lu_device *mdd_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
01150                                           struct lu_device_type *t,
01151                                           struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
01152 {
01153         struct lu_device  *l;
01154         struct mdd_device *m;
01155 
01156         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(m);
01157         if (m == NULL) {
01158                 l = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
01159         } else {
01160                 int rc;
01161 
01162                 l = mdd2lu_dev(m);
01163                 md_device_init(&m->mdd_md_dev, t);
01164                 rc = mdd_init0(env, m, t, lcfg);
01165                 if (rc != 0) {
01166                         mdd_device_free(env, l);
01167                         l = ERR_PTR(rc);
01168                 }
01169         }
01170 
01171         return l;
01172 }
01173 
01174 /*
01175  * we use exports to track all mdd users
01176  */
01177 static int mdd_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export **exp,
01178                            struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
01179                            struct obd_connect_data *data, void *localdata)
01180 {
01181         struct mdd_device    *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01182         struct lustre_handle  conn;
01183         int                   rc;
01184         ENTRY;
01185 
01186         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", mdd->mdd_connects);
01187 
01188         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
01189         if (rc)
01190                 RETURN(rc);
01191 
01192         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
01193 
01194         /* Why should there ever be more than 1 connect? */
01195         LASSERT(mdd->mdd_connects == 0);
01196         mdd->mdd_connects++;
01197 
01198         RETURN(0);
01199 }
01200 
01201 /*
01202  * once last export (we don't count self-export) disappeared
01203  * mdd can be released
01204  */
01205 static int mdd_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
01206 {
01207         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01208         struct mdd_device *mdd = lu2mdd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01209         int                rc, release = 0;
01210         ENTRY;
01211 
01212         mdd->mdd_connects--;
01213         if (mdd->mdd_connects == 0)
01214                 release = 1;
01215 
01216         rc = class_disconnect(exp);
01217 
01218         if (rc == 0 && release)
01219                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
01220         RETURN(rc);
01221 }
01222 
01223 static int mdd_obd_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01224                             __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
01225 {
01226         int rc = -EINVAL;
01227 
01228         if (KEY_IS(KEY_OSP_CONNECTED)) {
01229                 struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01230                 struct mdd_device       *mdd;
01231 
01232                 if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping)
01233                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01234 
01235                 mdd = lu2mdd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01236                 LASSERT(mdd);
01237                 rc = obd_get_info(env, mdd->mdd_child_exp, keylen, key, vallen,
01238                                   val);
01239                 RETURN(rc);
01240         }
01241 
01242         RETURN(rc);
01243 }
01244 
01245 static int mdd_obd_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env,
01246                                   struct obd_export *exp,
01247                                   __u32 keylen, void *key,
01248                                   __u32 vallen, void *val,
01249                                   struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
01250 {
01251         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01252         struct mdd_device       *mdd;
01253         int                      rc;
01254 
01255         if (!obd->obd_set_up || obd->obd_stopping)
01256                 RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01257 
01258         mdd = lu2mdd_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
01259         LASSERT(mdd);
01260         rc = obd_set_info_async(env, mdd->mdd_child_exp, keylen, key,
01261                                 vallen, val, set);
01262         RETURN(rc);
01263 }
01264 
01265 static struct obd_ops mdd_obd_device_ops = {
01266         .o_owner        = THIS_MODULE,
01267         .o_connect      = mdd_obd_connect,
01268         .o_disconnect   = mdd_obd_disconnect,
01269         .o_get_info     = mdd_obd_get_info,
01270         .o_set_info_async = mdd_obd_set_info_async,
01271 };
01272 
01273 static int mdd_changelog_user_register(const struct lu_env *env,
01274                                        struct mdd_device *mdd, int *id)
01275 {
01276         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
01277         struct llog_changelog_user_rec *rec;
01278         int rc;
01279         ENTRY;
01280 
01281         ctxt = llog_get_context(mdd2obd_dev(mdd),
01282                                 LLOG_CHANGELOG_USER_ORIG_CTXT);
01283         if (ctxt == NULL)
01284                 RETURN(-ENXIO);
01285 
01286         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(rec);
01287         if (rec == NULL) {
01288                 llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01289                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01290         }
01291 
01292         /* Assume we want it on since somebody registered */
01293         rc = mdd_changelog_on(env, mdd);
01294         if (rc)
01295                 GOTO(out, rc);
01296 
01297         rec->cur_hdr.lrh_len = sizeof(*rec);
01298         rec->cur_hdr.lrh_type = CHANGELOG_USER_REC;
01299         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
01300         if (mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lastuser == (unsigned int)(-1)) {
01301                 spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
01302                 CERROR("Maximum number of changelog users exceeded!\n");
01303                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
01304         }
01305         *id = rec->cur_id = ++mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lastuser;
01306         rec->cur_endrec = mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index;
01307         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_user_lock);
01308 
01309         rc = llog_cat_add(env, ctxt->loc_handle, &rec->cur_hdr, NULL);
01310 
01311         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Registered changelog user %d\n", *id);
01312 out:
01313         OBD_FREE_PTR(rec);
01314         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01315         RETURN(rc);
01316 }
01317 
01318 struct mdd_changelog_user_data {
01319         __u64 mcud_endrec; 
01320         __u64 mcud_minrec; 
01321         __u32 mcud_id;
01322         __u32 mcud_minid;  
01323         __u32 mcud_usercount;
01324         unsigned int mcud_found:1;
01325 };
01326 #define MCUD_UNREGISTER -1LL
01327 
01332 static int mdd_changelog_user_purge_cb(const struct lu_env *env,
01333                                        struct llog_handle *llh,
01334                                        struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr, void *data)
01335 {
01336         struct llog_changelog_user_rec  *rec;
01337         struct mdd_changelog_user_data  *mcud = data;
01338         int                              rc;
01339 
01340         ENTRY;
01341 
01342         LASSERT(llh->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_PLAIN);
01343 
01344         rec = (struct llog_changelog_user_rec *)hdr;
01345 
01346         mcud->mcud_usercount++;
01347 
01348         /* If we have a new endrec for this id, use it for the following
01349            min check instead of its old value */
01350         if (rec->cur_id == mcud->mcud_id)
01351                 rec->cur_endrec = max(rec->cur_endrec, mcud->mcud_endrec);
01352 
01353         /* Track the minimum referenced record */
01354         if (mcud->mcud_minid == 0 || mcud->mcud_minrec > rec->cur_endrec) {
01355                 mcud->mcud_minid = rec->cur_id;
01356                 mcud->mcud_minrec = rec->cur_endrec;
01357         }
01358 
01359         if (rec->cur_id != mcud->mcud_id)
01360                 RETURN(0);
01361 
01362         /* Update this user's record */
01363         mcud->mcud_found = 1;
01364 
01365         /* Special case: unregister this user */
01366         if (mcud->mcud_endrec == MCUD_UNREGISTER) {
01367                 struct llog_cookie cookie;
01368 
01369                 cookie.lgc_lgl = llh->lgh_id;
01370                 cookie.lgc_index = hdr->lrh_index;
01371 
01372                 rc = llog_cat_cancel_records(env, llh->u.phd.phd_cat_handle,
01373                                              1, &cookie);
01374                 if (rc == 0)
01375                         mcud->mcud_usercount--;
01376 
01377                 RETURN(rc);
01378         }
01379 
01380         /* Update the endrec */
01381         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Rewriting changelog user %d endrec to "LPU64"\n",
01382                mcud->mcud_id, rec->cur_endrec);
01383 
01384         rc = llog_write(env, llh, hdr, hdr->lrh_index);
01385 
01386         RETURN(rc);
01387 }
01388 
01389 static int mdd_changelog_user_purge(const struct lu_env *env,
01390                                     struct mdd_device *mdd, int id,
01391                                     long long endrec)
01392 {
01393         struct mdd_changelog_user_data data;
01394         struct llog_ctxt *ctxt;
01395         int rc;
01396         ENTRY;
01397 
01398         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Purge request: id=%d, endrec=%lld\n", id, endrec);
01399 
01400         data.mcud_id = id;
01401         data.mcud_minid = 0;
01402         data.mcud_minrec = 0;
01403         data.mcud_usercount = 0;
01404         data.mcud_endrec = endrec;
01405         spin_lock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
01406         endrec = mdd->mdd_cl.mc_index;
01407         spin_unlock(&mdd->mdd_cl.mc_lock);
01408         if ((data.mcud_endrec == 0) ||
01409             ((data.mcud_endrec > endrec) &&
01410              (data.mcud_endrec != MCUD_UNREGISTER)))
01411                 data.mcud_endrec = endrec;
01412 
01413         ctxt = llog_get_context(mdd2obd_dev(mdd),
01414                                 LLOG_CHANGELOG_USER_ORIG_CTXT);
01415         if (ctxt == NULL)
01416                 return -ENXIO;
01417 
01418         LASSERT(ctxt->loc_handle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT);
01419 
01420         rc = llog_cat_process(env, ctxt->loc_handle,
01421                               mdd_changelog_user_purge_cb, (void *)&data,
01422                               0, 0);
01423         if ((rc >= 0) && (data.mcud_minrec > 0)) {
01424                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Purging changelog entries up to "LPD64
01425                        ", referenced by "CHANGELOG_USER_PREFIX"%d\n",
01426                        data.mcud_minrec, data.mcud_minid);
01427                 rc = mdd_changelog_llog_cancel(env, mdd, data.mcud_minrec);
01428         } else {
01429                 CWARN("Could not determine changelog records to purge; rc=%d\n",
01430                       rc);
01431         }
01432 
01433         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01434 
01435         if (!data.mcud_found) {
01436                 CWARN("No entry for user %d.  Last changelog reference is "
01437                       LPD64" by changelog user %d\n", data.mcud_id,
01438                       data.mcud_minrec, data.mcud_minid);
01439                rc = -ENOENT;
01440         }
01441 
01442         if (!rc && data.mcud_usercount == 0)
01443                 /* No more users; turn changelogs off */
01444                 rc = mdd_changelog_off(env, mdd);
01445 
01446         RETURN(rc);
01447 }
01448 
01457 static int mdd_iocontrol(const struct lu_env *env, struct md_device *m,
01458                          unsigned int cmd, int len, void *karg)
01459 {
01460         struct mdd_device *mdd;
01461         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
01462         int rc;
01463         ENTRY;
01464 
01465         mdd = lu2mdd_dev(&m->md_lu_dev);
01466 
01467         /* Doesn't use obd_ioctl_data */
01468         switch (cmd) {
01469         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_CLEAR: {
01470                 struct changelog_setinfo *cs = karg;
01471                 rc = mdd_changelog_user_purge(env, mdd, cs->cs_id,
01472                                               cs->cs_recno);
01473                 RETURN(rc);
01474         }
01475         case OBD_IOC_GET_MNTOPT: {
01476                 mntopt_t *mntopts = (mntopt_t *)karg;
01477                 *mntopts = mdd->mdd_dt_conf.ddp_mntopts;
01478                 RETURN(0);
01479         }
01480         case OBD_IOC_START_LFSCK: {
01481                 rc = lfsck_start(env, mdd->mdd_bottom,
01482                                  (struct lfsck_start_param *)karg);
01483                 RETURN(rc);
01484         }
01485         case OBD_IOC_STOP_LFSCK: {
01486                 rc = lfsck_stop(env, mdd->mdd_bottom,
01487                                 (struct lfsck_stop *)karg);
01488                 RETURN(rc);
01489         }
01490         case OBD_IOC_QUERY_LFSCK: {
01491                 rc = lfsck_query(env, mdd->mdd_bottom, NULL, NULL,
01492                                  (struct lfsck_query *)karg);
01493                 RETURN(rc);
01494         }
01495         }
01496 
01497         /* Below ioctls use obd_ioctl_data */
01498         if (len != sizeof(*data)) {
01499                 CERROR("Bad ioctl size %d\n", len);
01500                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01501         }
01502         if (data->ioc_version != OBD_IOCTL_VERSION) {
01503                 CERROR("Bad magic %x != %x\n", data->ioc_version,
01504                        OBD_IOCTL_VERSION);
01505                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01506         }
01507 
01508         switch (cmd) {
01509         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_REG:
01510                 rc = mdd_changelog_user_register(env, mdd, &data->ioc_u32_1);
01511                 break;
01512         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_DEREG:
01513                 rc = mdd_changelog_user_purge(env, mdd, data->ioc_u32_1,
01514                                               MCUD_UNREGISTER);
01515                 break;
01516         default:
01517                 rc = -ENOTTY;
01518         }
01519 
01520         RETURN (rc);
01521 }

01557 static void mdd_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,
01558                          struct lu_context_key *key, void *data)
01559 {
01560         struct mdd_thread_info *info = data;
01561

01563         lu_buf_free(&info->mti_link_buf);

01570 
01571 int mdd_generic_thread_start(struct mdd_generic_thread *thread,
01572                              int (*func)(void *), void *data, char *name)
01573 {
01574         struct task_struct      *task;
01575 
01576         LASSERT(thread->mgt_init == false);
01577         init_completion(&thread->mgt_started);
01578         init_completion(&thread->mgt_finished);
01579         thread->mgt_data = data;
01580         thread->mgt_abort = false;
01581         thread->mgt_init = true;
01582 
01583         task = kthread_run(func, thread, name);
01584         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01585                 complete(&thread->mgt_finished);
01586                 return PTR_ERR(task);
01587         }
01588         wait_for_completion(&thread->mgt_started);
01589         return 0;
01590 }
01591 
01592 void mdd_generic_thread_stop(struct mdd_generic_thread *thread)
01593 {
01594         if (thread->mgt_init == true) {
01595                 thread->mgt_abort = true;
01596                 wait_for_completion(&thread->mgt_finished);
01597         }
01598 }
01599 
01600 static int __init mdd_init(void)
01601 {
01602         int rc;
01603 
01604         rc = lu_kmem_init(mdd_caches);
01605         if (rc)
01606                 return rc;
01607 
01608         changelog_orig_logops = llog_osd_ops;
01609         changelog_orig_logops.lop_cancel = llog_changelog_cancel;
01610         changelog_orig_logops.lop_add = llog_cat_add_rec;
01611         changelog_orig_logops.lop_declare_add = llog_cat_declare_add_rec;
01612 
01613         hsm_actions_logops = llog_osd_ops;
01614         hsm_actions_logops.lop_add = llog_cat_add_rec;
01615         hsm_actions_logops.lop_declare_add = llog_cat_declare_add_rec;
01616 
01617         rc = class_register_type(&mdd_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
01618                                  LUSTRE_MDD_NAME, &mdd_device_type);
01619         if (rc)
01620                 lu_kmem_fini(mdd_caches);
01621         return rc;
01622 }
01623 
01624 static void __exit mdd_exit(void)
01625 {
01626         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_MDD_NAME);
01627         lu_kmem_fini(mdd_caches);
01628 }
